results.title: Effects of statins on progression of subclinical brain infarct.
results.text_hl: Among putative variables, multivariate regression analysis showed that only the baseline number of SBIs (OR = 6.27, 95% CI 2.4-16.5) and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment (OR = 0.09, 95% CI 0.01-0.82) independently predicted the development of new @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020520 @@@brain infarcts@@@.

citations.NLM: Fu JH, Mok V, Lam W, Wong A, Chu W, Xiong Y, Ng PW, Tsoi TH, Yeung V, Wong KS. Effects of statins on progression of subclinical brain infarct. Cerebrovasc Dis. 2010;30(1):51-6. PMID: 20431290
citations.BibTeX: @article{20431290, title={Effects of statins on progression of subclinical brain infarct.}, author={Fu JH and Mok V and Lam W and Wong A and Chu W and Xiong Y and Ng PW and Tsoi TH and Yeung V and Wong KS}, journal={Cerebrovasc Dis}, volume={30}, number={1}, pages={51-6}}

results.title: Chemokine, vascular and therapeutic effects of combination Simvastatin and BMSC treatment of stroke.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ significantly increased @GENE_CXCL12 @GENE_24772 @@@stromal cell-derived factor-1@@@ (@GENE_CXCL12 @GENE_24772 @@@SDF1@@@) expression in the @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020520 @@@ischemic brain@@@ and @GENE_CXCR4 @GENE_60628 @@@chemokine (CXC motif) receptor-4@@@ (@GENE_CXCR4 @GENE_60628 @@@CXCR4@@@) in BMSCs, and increased BMSC migration to RBMECs and astrocytes.

citations.NLM: Cui X, Chopp M, Zacharek A, Roberts C, Lu M, Savant-Bhonsale S, Chen J. Chemokine, vascular and therapeutic effects of combination Simvastatin and BMSC treatment of stroke. Neurobiol Dis. 2009 Oct;36(1):35-41. PMID: 19591934
citations.BibTeX: @article{19591934, title={Chemokine, vascular and therapeutic effects of combination Simvastatin and BMSC treatment of stroke.}, author={Cui X and Chopp M and Zacharek A and Roberts C and Lu M and Savant-Bhonsale S and Chen J}, journal={Neurobiol Dis}, volume={36}, number={1}, pages={35-41}}

results.title: Treatment with statins after induction of focal ischemia in rats reduces the extent of brain damage.
results.text_hl: In vehicle-treated @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@, the @DISEASE_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D007238 @@@infarct@@@ volumes increased by 38.5% and 89% after 24 and 48 hours, respectively, compared with the damage detected at 2 hours after MCAO. Treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (20 mg/kg) after MCAO prevented the increase in @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020520 @@@brain infarct@@@ volume occurring at 24 hours and induced a 46.6% reduction after 48 hours.

citations.NLM: Sironi L, Cimino M, Guerrini U, Calvio AM, Lodetti B, Asdente M, Balduini W, Paoletti R, Tremoli E. Treatment with statins after induction of focal ischemia in rats reduces the extent of brain damage. Arterioscler Thromb Vasc Biol. 2003 Feb 1;23(2):322-7. PMID: 12588778
citations.BibTeX: @article{12588778, title={Treatment with statins after induction of focal ischemia in rats reduces the extent of brain damage.}, author={Sironi L and Cimino M and Guerrini U and Calvio AM and Lodetti B and Asdente M and Balduini W and Paoletti R and Tremoli E}, journal={Arterioscler Thromb Vasc Biol}, volume={23}, number={2}, pages={322-7}}

results.title: Upregulation of Protein Phosphatase 2A and NR3A-Pleiotropic Effect of Simvastatin on Ischemic Stroke Rats
results.text_hl: The results showed that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ decreased @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020520 @@@brain ischemic infarct@@@ area significantly while increasing the expression levels of PP2A and @GENE_GRIN3A @GENE_191573 @@@NR3A@@@, thus dephosphorylating the serine sites of @GENE_GRIN1 @GENE_24408 @@@NR1@@@ (ser896 and ser897) along with increased enzymatic activities of PP2A.

citations.NLM: Zhu M, Wang J, Liu M, Du D, Xia C, Shen L, Zhu D. Upregulation of Protein Phosphatase 2A and NR3A-Pleiotropic Effect of Simvastatin on Ischemic Stroke Rats PLoS One. 2012;7(12):e51552. PMID: 23251573
citations.BibTeX: @article{23251573, title={Upregulation of Protein Phosphatase 2A and NR3A-Pleiotropic Effect of Simvastatin on Ischemic Stroke Rats}, author={Zhu M and Wang J and Liu M and Du D and Xia C and Shen L and Zhu D}, journal={PLoS One}, volume={7}, number={12}, pages={e51552}}

results.title: Reduction of ischemic brain injury in rats with normothermic and hyperthermic conditions.
results.text_hl: They then studied whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ could reduce the @DISEASE_Basal_Ganglia_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D001480 @@@perfusion@@@ deficits, damage to the blood-brain barrier (BBB), and degeneration of neurons in the @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020520 @@@ischemic injured brain@@@.

citations.NLM: Shabanzadeh AP, Shuaib A, Wang CX. Reduction of ischemic brain injury in rats with normothermic and hyperthermic conditions. J Neurosurg. 2008 Sep;109(3):522-9. PMID: 18759586
citations.BibTeX: @article{18759586, title={Reduction of ischemic brain injury in rats with normothermic and hyperthermic conditions.}, author={Shabanzadeh AP and Shuaib A and Wang CX}, journal={J Neurosurg}, volume={109}, number={3}, pages={522-9}}

results.title: Endothelial nitric oxide synthase-dependent cerebral blood flow augmentation by L-arginine after chronic statin treatment.
results.text_hl: Furthermore, pretreatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ enhanced blood flow within @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020520 @@@ischemic brain@@@ tissue after @DISEASE_Infarction_Middle_Cerebral_Artery @DISEASE_MESH:D020244 @@@middle cerebral artery occlusion@@@.

citations.NLM: Yamada M, Huang Z, Dalkara T, Endres M, Laufs U, Waeber C, Huang PL, Liao JK, Moskowitz MA. Endothelial nitric oxide synthase-dependent cerebral blood flow augmentation by L-arginine after chronic statin treatment. J Cereb Blood Flow Metab. 2000 Apr;20(4):709-17. PMID: 10779015
